intro: Indigofera garissaensis, commonly known as the Garissa indigo plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of East Africa, particularly in Kenya and Somalia. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Indigofera garissaensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing forage for livestock and habitat for various insects.
